alarm_message.textline: ALARM (R): check clean-global-namespace failed (violates AUTOSAR.7.3.1M-required, M2008.7.3.1-required)
ALARM (R): check inaccessible-external-function failed (violates AUTOSAR.3.3.1A-required, M2008.3.3.1-required)
ALARM (R): check integral-type-name failed (violates AUTOSAR.3.9.1A-required, M2008.3.9.2-advisory)
ALARM (R): check unary-assign-separation failed (violates AUTOSAR.5.2.10M-required, M2008.5.2.10-advisory)
ALARM (R): check comma-operator failed (violates AUTOSAR.5.18.1M-required, M2008.5.18.1-required)
ALARM (R): check loop-control-modification failed (violates AUTOSAR.6.5.5M-required, M2008.6.5.5-required)
ALARM (R): check function-name-usage failed (violates AUTOSAR.8.4.4M-required, M2008.8.4.4-required)

alarm_types.alarm_type: Object like macro name min length
Object like macro name max length
Object pointer diff cast strict implicit
Non virtual public destructor in non final class
Implicit non void lambda return type
Function like macro name min length
Function like macro name max length
Cast pointer void to function pointer

rule_descriptions.rule_description: Expressions with type (plain) char and wchar_t shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, and the unary & operator.
dynamic_cast should not be used.
Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated.
An explicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not increase the size of the underlying type of a cvalue expression.
Digraphs should not be used.
The signal handling facilities of <csignal> shall not be used.
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to an automatic variable (including parameters), defined within the function.
Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant.
The names of standard library macros and objects shall not be reused.
In the definition of a function-like macro, each instance of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses, unless it is used as the operand of # or ##.
using-directives and using-declarations (excluding class scope or function scope using-declarations) shall not be used in header files.
A project shall not contain unused variables.
A "U" suffix shall be applied to all octal or hexadecimal integer literals of unsigned type.
In an enumerator list, the = construct shall not be used to explicitly initialize members other than the first, unless all items are explicitly initialized.
Functions shall not be declared at block scope.
A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast.
Output parameters shall not be used.
Comparison operators shall be non-member functions with identical parameter types and noexcept.
using-directives shall not be used.
A non-POD type should be defined as class.
A cast shall not convert a pointer to a function to any other pointer type, including a pointer to function type.
Only those escape sequences that are defined in ISO/IEC 14882:2003 shall be used.
Control shall not be transferred into a try or catch block using a goto or a switch statement.
A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter.
The setjmp macro and the longjmp function shall not be used.
String literals with different encoding prefixes shall not be concatenated.
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the C++ standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined.
An if ( condition ) construct shall be followed by a compound statement. The else keyword shall be followed by either a compound statement, or another if statement.

Expressions with type enum shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the subscript operator [ ], the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator,and the relational operators <, <=, >, >=.
An object with integer type or pointer to void type shall not be converted to an object with pointer type.
The operands of a logical && or || shall be parenthesized if the operands contain binary operators.
Trigraphs shall not be used.
The goto statement shall not be used.
A class, union or enum name (including qualification, if any) shall be a unique identifier.
Bitwise operators shall only be applied to operands of unsigned underlying type.
The error indicator errno shall not be used.
The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body.
There shall be no implicit floating-integral conversions.
The loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or statement.
There shall be no unnamed namespaces in header files.
An implicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type.
All accessible entity names within a multiple inheritance hierarchy should be unique.
A type, object or function that is used in multiple translation units shall be declared in one and only one file.
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits.
Functions shall not be defined using the ellipsis notation.
If the # token appears as the first token on a line, then it shall be immediately followed by a preprocessing token.
The first operand of a conditional-operator shall have type bool.
All variables shall have a defined value before they are used.
Member functions shall not return non-const handles to class-data.
Different identifiers shall be typographically unambiguous.
The library functions abort, exit, getenv and system from library <cstdlib> shall not be used.
Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block for a derived class and some or all of its bases, the handlers shall be ordered most-derived to base class.
In the definition of a function-like macro, each instance of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses, unless it is used as the operand of # or ##.
An accessible base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy.
An implicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type.
All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause.
Functions shall not be defined using the ellipsis notation.
Typedefs that indicate size and signedness should be used in place of the basic numerical types.
The terminate() function shall not be called implicitly.
All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression.
All memory shall be initialized before it is read.
A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or expression.
Friend declarations shall not be used.
A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual.
Enumerations shall be declared as scoped enum classes.
The C library facilities shall only be accessed through C++ library headers.
Dynamic exception-specification shall not be used.
The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type.
Variables shall not be implicitly captured in a lambda expression.
Assembler instructions shall only be introduced using the asm declaration.
If the bitwise operators ~ and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand.
The identifiers used for the parameters in a re-declaration of a function shall be identical to those in the declaration.
Before preprocessing, a null statement shall only occur on a line by itself; it may be followed by a comment, provided that the first character following the null statement is a whitespace character.
Evaluation of the operand to the sizeof operator shall not contain side effects.
Volatile keyword shall not be used.
The library functions atof, atoi and atol from library <cstdlib> shall not be used.
Undefined macro identifiers shall not be used in #if or #elif preprocessor directives, except as operands to the defined operator.
The setjmp macro and the longjmp function shall not be used.
There shall be no more than one definition of each virtual function on each path through the inheritance hierarchy.
A cast shall not remove any const or volatile qualification from the type of a pointer or reference.
#include directives in a file shall only be preceded by other preprocessor directives or comments.
A project shall not contain unreachable code.
Macros shall only be #defined or #undefd in the global namespace.
A class type exception shall always be caught by reference.
In an enumeration, either (1) none, (2) the first or (3) all enumerators shall be initialized.
Clang warnings.
Virtual function declaration shall contain exactly one of the three specifiers: (1) virtual, (2) override, (3) final.
Objects or functions with external linkage shall be declared in a header file.
The statement forming the body of a switch, while, do ... while or for statement shall be a compound statement.
The error state of a conversion from string to a numeric value shall be checked.
The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations.
A class type exception shall be caught by reference or const reference.
A variable of type auto shall not be initialized using {} or ={} braced-initialization.
A for loop shall contain a single loop-counter which shall not have floating type.
All declarations of an object or function shall have compatible types.
A project shall not contain unused type declarations.

A type defined as struct shall: (1) provide only public data members, (2) not provide any special member functions or methods, (3) not be a base of another struct or class, (4) not inherit from another struct or class.
The macro offsetof shall not be used.
Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool.
The loop-counter shall be modified by one of: --, ++, -=n, or +=n; where n remains constant for the duration of the loop.
The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned.
Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block, any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last.
The defined preprocessor operator shall only be used in one of the two standard forms.
The identifier main shall not be used for a function other than the global function main.
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined.
A lambda shall not be an operand to decltype or typeid.
Evaluation of the operand to the sizeof operator shall not contain side effects.
The typedef specifier shall not be used.
Each operand of a logical && or || shall be a postfix expression.
If a member function can be made static then it shall be made static, otherwise if it can be made const then it shall be made const.
An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause.
The comma operator, && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded.
A cvalue expression shall not be implicitly converted to a different underlying type.
Macros shall only be #defined or #undefd in the global namespace.
signed char and unsigned char type shall only be used for the storage and use of numeric values.
An object's dynamic type shall not be used from the body of its constructor or destructor.
Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall either use the same default arguments as the function they override, or else shall not specify any default arguments.
Type wchar_t shall not be used.

In an initialization list, the order of initialization shall be following: (1) virtual base classes in depth and left to right order of the inheritance graph, (2) direct base classes in left to right order of inheritance list, (3) non-static data members in the order they were declared in the class definition.
A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter which is modified in statement shall have type bool.
The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment.
The # and ## operators should not be used.
A cast shall not remove any const or volatile qualification from the type of a pointer or reference.
If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final.
The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration-statement shall have type bool.
A cast should not convert a pointer type to an integral type.
The One Definition Rule shall not be violated.
If a function is declared with an exception-specification, then all declarations of the same function (in other translation units) shall be declared with the same set of type-ids.
The comma operator shall not be used.
The identifier main shall not be used for a function other than the global function main.
The identifiers used for the parameters in a re-declaration of a function shall be identical to those in the declaration.
All declarations of an object or function shall have compatible types.
The # and ## operators should not be used.
Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block, any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last.
Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the override or final specifier.
NULL shall not be thrown explicitly.
Parameter list (possibly empty) shall be included in every lambda expression.
The comma operator, && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded.
const member functions shall not return non-const pointers or references to class-data.
All accessible entity names within a multiple inheritance hierarchy should be unique.
The error indicator errno shall not be used.
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object.
All uses of the #pragma directive shall be documented.
The first operand of a conditional-operator shall have type bool.
There shall be no unnamed namespaces in header files.
Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement.
If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier.
The unbounded functions of library <cstring> shall not be used.
Octal constants (other than zero) and octal escape sequences (other than "\0") shall not be used.
Multiple declarations for an identifier in the same namespace shall not straddle a using-declaration for that identifier.
The value returned by a function having a non-void return type that is not an overloaded operator shall always be used.
The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations.
The increment (++) and decrement (--) operators should not be mixed with other operators in an expression.
The increment (++) and decrement (--) operators should not be mixed with other operators in an expression.
The right hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not contain side effects.
A copy constructor shall be declared when there is a template constructor with a single parameter that is a generic parameter.
Classes should not be derived from virtual bases.
The types used for an object, a function return type, or a function parameter shall be token-for-token identical in all declarations and re-declarations.
An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause.
A switch statement shall have at least two case-clauses, distinct from the default label.
The loop-counter shall be modified by one of: --, ++, -=n, or +=n; where n remains constant for the duration of the loop.
Functions declared with the [[noreturn]] attribute shall not return.
There should be no unused type declarations.
Pointers to incomplete class types shall not be deleted.
Literal suffixes shall be upper case.
NULL shall not be thrown explicitly.
There shall be at most one occurrence of the # or ## operators in a single macro definition.
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by reference to const.
The underlying bit representations of floating-point values shall not be used.
The asm declaration shall not be used.
A project shall not contain infeasible paths.
The C library shall not be used.
The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment.
Different identifiers shall be typographically unambiguous.
A class, structure, or enumeration shall not be declared in the definition of its type.
Include guards shall be provided.
The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body.
Only those escape sequences that are defined in ISO/IEC 14882:2014 shall be used.
Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives.
The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause.
Lambda expressions should not be defined inside another lambda expression.
Directives are required to follow the syntax and constraints specified in the manual.
Objects or functions with external linkage (including members of named namespaces) shall be declared in a header file.
A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter which is modified in statement shall have type bool.
All user-defined conversion operators shall be defined explicit.
Every function defined in an anonymous namespace, or static function with internal linkage, or private member function shall be used.
The unary & operator shall not be overloaded.
The \ character should not occur in a header file name.
A function identifier shall either be used to call the function or it shall be preceded by &.
Unions shall not be used.
There shall be no explicit floating-integral conversions of a cvalue expression.
A base class shall only be declared virtual if it is used in a diamond hierarchy.
using-directives shall not be used.
An object with integer type or pointer to void type shall not be converted to an object with pointer type.
Member functions shall not return non-const "raw" pointers or references to private or protected data owned by the class.
The unbounded functions of library <cstring> shall not be used.
using-directives and using-declarations (excluding class scope or function scope using-declarations) shall not be used in header files.
Bitwise operators shall only be applied to operands of unsigned underlying type.
An implicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not reduce the size of the underlying type.
Bit-fields shall not have enum type.
Assembler instructions shall only be introduced using the asm declaration.
Only nullptr literal shall be used as the null-pointer-constant.
All #else, #elif and #endif preprocessor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if or #ifdef directive to which they are related.
Floating-point expressions shall not be directly or indirectly tested for equality or inequality.
There shall be at most one occurrence of the # or ## operators in a single macro definition.
If a function generates error information, then that error information shall be tested.
Every defined function shall be called at least once.
If loop-counter is not modified by -- or ++, then, within condition, the loop-counter shall only be used as an operand to <=, <, > or >=.
An explicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not increase the size of the underlying type of a cvalue expression.
The plain char type shall only be used for the storage and use of character values.
Array indexing shall be the only form of pointer arithmetic.
Undefined macro identifiers shall not be used in #if or #elif preprocessor directives, except as operands to the defined operator.
The #include directive shall be followed by either a <filename> or "filename" sequence.
A switch-label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement.
An init-declarator-list or a member-declarator-list shall consist of a single init-declarator or member-declarator respectively.

The pre-processor shall only be used for unconditional and conditional file inclusion and include guards, and using the following directives: (1) #ifndef, (2) #ifdef, (3) #if, (4) #if defined, (5) #elif, (6) #else, (7) #define, (8) #endif, (9) #include.
Literal suffixes shall be upper case.
The unary & operator shall not be overloaded.
Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool.
An if ( condition ) construct shall be followed by a compound statement. The else keyword shall be followed by either a compound statement, or another if statement.
There shall be no unused named parameters in non-virtual functions.
The pre-processor shall only be used for file inclusion and include guards.
Traditional C-style casts shall not be used.
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit.
Non-constant operands to a binary bitwise operator shall have the same underlying type.
If a function generates error information, then that error information shall be tested.
A relational operator shall return a boolean value.
An explicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type of a cvalue expression.
The comma operator shall not be used.
A cast shall not convert a pointer to a function to any other pointer type, including a pointer to function type.
There shall be no explicit floating-integral conversions of a cvalue expression.
A function shall have a single point of exit at the end of the function.
A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement.
#error directive shall not be used.
Classes should not be derived from virtual bases.
Include guards shall be provided.
Octal constants (other than zero) and octal escape sequences (other than "\0") shall not be used.
An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer.
Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall either use the same default arguments as the function they override, or else shall not specify any default arguments.
Assignment operators should be declared with the ref-qualifier &.
Explicit specializations of function templates shall not be used.
A project shall not contain non-volatile POD variables having only one use.
A project shall not contain unreachable code.
Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives.
Expression statements shall not be explicit calls to constructors of temporary objects only.
An object shall not be accessed outside of its lifetime.
Narrow and wide string literals shall not be concatenated.
There shall be no implicit floating-integral conversions.
An exception object should not have pointer type.
A type, object or function that is used in multiple translation units shall be declared in one and only one file.
A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual.
For any iteration statement there shall be no more than one break or goto statement used for loop termination.
Pointer arithmetic shall not be used with pointers to non-final classes.
Hexadecimal constants should be upper case.
A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual.
Array indexing shall be the only form of pointer arithmetic.
An object with pointer type shall not be converted to an unrelated pointer type, either directly or indirectly.
A copy constructor shall only initialize its base classes and the non-static members of the class of which it is a member.
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object.
const member functions shall not return non-const pointers or references to class-data.
Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated.
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by reference or const reference.
Before preprocessing, a null statement shall only occur on a line by itself; it may be followed by a comment, provided that the first character following the null statement is a whitespace character.
A project shall not contain unused variables.
The library <clocale> (locale.h) and the setlocale function shall not be used.
NULL shall not be used as an integer value.
The declaration of objects shall contain no more than two levels of pointer indirection.
The time handling functions of library <ctime> shall not be used.
Dynamic heap memory allocation shall not be used.
If the bitwise operators ~ and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand.
An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer.
String literals shall not be assigned to non-constant pointers.
The types used for an object, a function return type, or a function parameter shall be token-for-token identical in all declarations and re-declarations.
The character \ shall not occur as a last character of a C++ comment.
The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause.
signed char and unsigned char type shall only be used for the storage and use of numeric values.
Member data in non-POD class types shall be private.
Digraphs shall not be used.
Trigraphs shall not be used.

Expressions with type bool shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the logical operators &&, ||, !, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator, and the conditional operator.
A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast.
All #else, #elif and #endif preprocessor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if or #ifdef directive to which they are related.
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions.
When an array with external linkage is declared, its size shall be stated explicitly.
Every defined function shall be called at least once.
Enumeration underlying base type shall be explicitly defined.
The register keyword shall not be used.
Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types.
The time handling functions of library <ctime> shall not be used.
If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier.
All partial and explicit specializations for a template shall be declared in the same file as the declaration of their primary template.
Non-constant operands to a binary bitwise operator shall have the same underlying type.
User-defined conversion operators should not be used.
The copy assignment operator shall be declared protected or private in an abstract class.
The declaration of objects shall contain no more than two levels of pointer indirection.
If loop-counter is not modified by -- or ++, then, within condition, the loop-counter shall only be used as an operand to <=, <, > or >=.
When an array is declared, its size shall either be stated explicitly or defined implicitly by initialization.
Function-like macros shall not be defined.
An object's dynamic type shall not be used from the body of its constructor or destructor.
A base class shall only be declared virtual if it is used in a diamond hierarchy.
There should be at least one exception handler to catch all otherwise unhandled exceptions.
The macro offsetof shall not be used.
Unions shall not be used.
The #pragma directive shall not be used.
A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or expression.
Functions shall not be declared at block scope.
The plain char type shall only be used for the storage and use of character values.
There shall be no dead code.
The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type.
The right hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not contain side effects.
All constructors of a class should explicitly call a constructor for all of its immediate base classes and all virtual base classes.
reinterpret_cast shall not be used.
An accessible base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy.
A typedef name (including qualification, if any) shall be a unique identifier.
Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.
The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration statement shall have type bool.
A switch-label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement.
Named bit-fields with signed integer type shall have a length of more than one bit.
A cvalue expression shall not be implicitly converted to a different underlying type.
Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types.
A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement.
The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned.
An explicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type of a cvalue expression.
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit.
Fixed width integer types from <cstdint>, indicating the size and signedness, shall be used in place of the basic numerical types.
An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one definition.
Do statements should not be used.
NULL shall not be used as an integer value.
Virtual functions shall not be introduced in a final class.
The continue statement shall only be used within a well-formed for loop.
The right hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the underlying type of the left hand operand.
The right hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the underlying type of the left hand operand.
Floating-point expressions shall not be directly or indirectly tested for equality or inequality.
Every switch statement shall have at least one case-clause.
The stream input/output library <cstdio> shall not be used.
User defined suffixes of the user defined literal operators shall start with underscore followed by one or more letters.
The loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or statement.
An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one definition.
Header files, that are defined locally in the project, shall have a file name extension of one of: ".h", ".hpp" or ".hxx".
Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor or destructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases.
Assignment operators shall not be used in sub-expressions.
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions.
Implementation files, that are defined locally in the project, should have a file name extension of ".cpp".
Assignment operators shall not be used in sub-expressions.
Member data in non-POD class types shall be private.
An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound-statement of a catch handler.
Functions should not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.
A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter.
Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement.
If a member function can be made static then it shall be made static, otherwise if it can be made const then it shall be made const.
C++ macros shall only be used for: include guards, type qualifiers, or storage class specifiers.
The library functions abort, exit, getenv and system from library <cstdlib> shall not be used.
The stream input/output library <cstdio> shall not be used.
If the # token appears as the first token on a line, then it shall be immediately followed by a preprocessing token.
A cast should not convert a pointer type to an integral type.
Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor or destructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases.
The underlying bit representations of floating-point values shall not be used.
There shall be no dead code.
Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the virtual keyword.
C-style casts (other than void casts) and functional notation casts (other than explicit constructor calls) shall not be used.

Expressions with type bool shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the logical operators &&, ||, !, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator, and the conditional operator.
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to an automatic variable (including parameters), defined within the function.
Return type of a non-void return type lambda expression should be explicitly specified.
There shall be no unused parameters (named or unnamed) in non-virtual functions.
The names of standard library macros and objects shall not be reused.
All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression.
Control shall not be transferred into a try or catch block using a goto or a switch statement.
Each expression statement and identifier declaration shall be placed on a separate line.
The statement forming the body of a switch, while, do ... while or for statement shall be a compound statement.
Type long double shall not be used.
The , ", /*, //, \ characters shall not occur in a header file name or in #include directive.
A function identifier shall either be used to call the function or it shall be preceded by &.
The continue statement shall only be used within a well-formed for loop.
#include directives in a file shall only be preceded by other preprocessor directives or comments.
An implicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not reduce the size of the underlying type.
Braced-initialization {}, without equals sign, shall be used for variable initialization.
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits.
An exception object shall not be a pointer.
An init-declarator-list or a member-declarator-list shall consist of a single init-declarator or member-declarator respectively.
The defined preprocessor operator shall only be used in one of the two standard forms.
A project shall not contain non-volatile POD variables having only one use.
The One Definition Rule shall not be violated.
Expressions with type (plain) char and wchar_t shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, and the unary & operator.
Named bit-fields with signed integer type shall have a length of more than one bit.
Braces shall be used to indicate and match the structure in the non-zero initialization of arrays and structures.
A project shall not contain infeasible paths.
An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound-statement of a catch handler.
A "U" suffix shall be applied to all octal or hexadecimal integer literals of unsigned type.
All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause.
The ', ", /* or // characters shall not occur in a header file name.
The signal handling facilities of <csignal> shall not be used.
Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant.
An assignment operator shall return a reference to "this".
Braces shall be used to indicate and match the structure in the non-zero initialization of arrays and structures.
#undef shall not be used.
The ternary conditional operator shall not be used as a sub-expression.

check_descriptions.check_description: #pragma asm shall not be used
Functions of external linkage shall have a declaration in a header file
Friend declarations shall not be used
There shall be no extra tokens at the end of a preprocessor directive.
Functions shall be declared at file scope.
Output parameters (i.e. non-const pointer or reference parameters) shall not be used
Partial, explicit specializations for a template shall reside in the same source file as the first declaration of this template
If a class (template) has an assignment operator taking a single generic parameter, there shall also be an explicit copy assignment operator
The delete operator shall not be used
Macro expansions shall not yield expressions
A tag shall be defined separately in a declaration not declaring objects of this type simultaniously
The C++ version of C standard headers shall be used (<cxxx> instead of <xxx.h>)
The ternary conditional operator shall not be used as a sub-expression
Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement.
using-directives (using namespace ...;) shall not be used in header files
A pointer to void shall not be casted into a pointer to object.
Bitfields of signed type shall be at least two bits long.
Lambda expressions shall not capture variables of automatic storage duration implicitly
ASM statements shall be encapsulated inside a dedicated function
A function shall not contain unused labels.
Header files shall provide include guards
Each expression statement shall be placed on a separate line
Warns about the operator delete used with incomplete type
Every initializer list shall be complete.
The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned.
Exception handlers in a class constructor or destructor shall not reference non-static members of this class
A lambda shall not be an operand to decltype
If present, a ... handler shall be the last handler for its try block
The types of two declarations denoting the same entity shall be identical
Reserved identifiers shall not be defined, redefined or undefined.
A final class shall not introduce virtual methods
The standard header <setjmp.h> (or <csetjmp>) shall not be included.
The body of a switch statement shall be a compound statement.
Each operand of && or || shall be a postfix expression
A class, union or enum name shall be a unique identifier.
Partial, explicit specializations for a template shall reside in the same source file as the first declaration of this template
Explicit conversions shall not be performed between a pointer to a function and any type other than an integer type.
A case clause shall not be terminated by a return statement.
Non-volatile POD variables shall not have only one use
Pure virtual functions shall have exactly one external definition
The identifiers used for parameters in a function declaration or definition shall be identical to previous declarations of this function or overridden functions.
The condition of an iteration-statement shall have type bool
A non-const member function shall not return a non-const reference or pointer to a private or protected class member
The return type of an assignment operator of class T shall be 'T&'
The && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded
A function with the attribute 'noreturn' shall not return
Unnamed namespaces shall not be in header files
A non-POD type shall be declared using the keyword 'class' instead of 'struct'
The first operand of a conditional-operator shall have type bool
Functions shall have at most one return statement positioned at the end of the program flow.
Operands of the logical operators && (and), || (or) and ! (not) shall have type bool
The lowercase character u shall not be used in a literal suffix
A cast shall not remove any volatile qualification from the type addressed by a pointer or reference.
A cast shall not be performed from a pointer to object type to an integral type
goto statements shall not be used.
A case clause shall not be terminated by a continue statement.
An external object or function shall be declared in one and only one file.
Do statements (do ... while(...);) shall not be used outside if function-like macros
Header files matching the given regular expression shall not be included.
Classes should not be derived from virtual bases
The standard header <signal.h> (or <csignal>) shall not be included.
The underlying type of a cvalue shall not be implicitly changed
using-declarations (using NS::...;) shall not be used
Octal escape sequences (except \0) shall not be used.
Local typedefs shall be used
There shall be at most one occurrence of the # or ## preprocessor operators in a single macro definition.
Different identifiers shall be typographically unambiguous, regardless of scope or namespace
Non-directive preprocessing directives shall be avoided.
The standard library functions "malloc", "calloc", "realloc" and "free" of the standard header <stdlib.h> shall not be used.
A 'struct' shall not be inherited from
A const member function shall not return a non-const reference or pointer to a private or protected class member
An object with pointer type shall not be converted to a pointer of unrelated type
Function like macros shall not be used.
Global variables unique to one translation unit shall not be unused
If a class (template) has a constructor taking a single generic parameter, there shall also be an explicit copy constructor
A loop-control-variable other than a loop-counter that is modified in the loop body shall have type bool
The unary increment (++) and decrement (--) operators shall not be mixed with other operators in an expression.
The operands of most binary and ternary operators shall be cast-expressions.
In an enumeration specification, automatic and manual allocation shall not be mixed.
Templates shall not be explicitly specialized
The names of C++ standard library macros shall not be #define'd
Floating point expressions shall not be tested for equality or inequality.
The copy assignment operator shall be declared protected or private in an abstract class
#include statements in a file shall only be preceded by other preprocessor directives or comments.
Bit-fields shall not have enum type
Functions shall not call themselves directly
Functions shall not be defined using the ellipsis notation.
Lambda expressions shall explicitly state the parameter list
The return value of a function shall be used.
The macro offsetof shall not be used.
The standard library function "getenv" shall not be used.
Keywords shall not be redefined.
A comparison operator shall be declared using 'noexcept'
If a function returns error information, this error information shall be tested.
There shall be no dead code
All if ... else constructs shall be terminated with an else clause.
The character \ shall not occur in header file names in #include directives.
The standard library functions "abort" and "exit" of the standard header <stdlib.h> shall not be used.
using-directives (using namespace ...;) shall not be used
A direct base shall not be inaccessible due to ambiguity with another base class
Narrow and wide string literals shall not be concatenated
Braces shall be used to indicate and match the structure in the non-zero initialization of arrays and structures.
Union fields shall not be assigned to a field of the same union object.
A cvalue (aka complex expression) shall not be casted explicitly from floating to integer type
A method overriding a virtual function shall be flagged 'override' or 'final'
Objects of plain char type shall not be used as numeric values.
There shall be no #else or #endif directive without associated #if, #ifdef or #ifndef directive in the same file.
String literals and their address shall be assigned only to pointer to const.
reinterpret_cast shall not be used
#pragma directives shall only be used in the specified manner.
A loop counter shall not have floating point type.
A copy constructor shall only initialize its base classes and non-static members
A 'struct' shall not have bases
An accessible base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy
A class type exception shall not be caught by value
A switch statement shall have at least the given number of 'case' labels
A cast shall not remove any const qualification from the type addressed by a pointer or reference.
A loop-counter shall only be modified by one of the following operators: ++, --, += and -=
The right-hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the underlying type of the left-hand operand.
Dynmic exception specification shall not be used
The character sequence // shall not occur in header file names in #include directives.
The continue statement shall only be used in well-formed loops
An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one external definition.
A function identifier shall only be used with either a preceding &, or with a parenthesised parameter list.
The operand of a throw statement shall not be of pointer type
The comma operator shall not be overloaded
A loop counter modified by an operation different from -- or ++ shall be compared using a relational operator
The content of a switch clause shall consist of a case-block-seq as defined in Misra C++:2008 Rule 6-4-3
Union types shall not be declared.
The heap memory allocation operator new shall not be used
Type declarations using 'typedef' shall not be used
If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, the respective class should be declared final
The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type
Classes should not be derived from virtual bases except for diamond hierarchies
Every switch statement shall have at least one case label.
There shall be no #else or #endif directive without associated #if, #ifdef or #ifndef directive in the same file.
Enum declarations shall have an explicit enum-base defining it's underlying base type
For external array declarations, the array size shall be stated.
Macros shall not be #defined or #undef'd within a block.
A pure virtual function shall only override a pure virtual function
The #include directive shall be followed by either a <filename> or "filename" sequence.
A 'struct' shall only have public data members
The storage class specifier 'register' shall not be used
Objects of union type shall not be declared.
All variables shall have a defined value before being used
A 'U' suffix shall be applied to all integer constants of unsigned type.
A using-declaration shall not be followed by additional declarations for the referred identifier
Type long double shall not be used
An iteration statement shall have at most one break or goto statement used for loop termination.
A switch statement shall handle all possible values
Octal constants (except 0) shall not be used.
A relational operator shall have return type bool
Lower-case shall not be used in hexadecimal constants
A method should have at most one the following specifiers: 'virtual', 'override', 'final'
#undef shall not be used.
Variables of type auto shall not be initialized using a brace-init-list
NULL shall not be used as an integer value
A 'struct' shall not have member functions
Lambda expressions shall state the return type explicitly unless it is void
Intervals specified in directives shall not exceed the range of values of the affected type.
A type shall be declared in one and only one file
If a binary operator is the operand to && or ||, it shall be parenthesized
An assignment operator shall return the value of the expression '*this'
Do not use C-style initialization (using =)
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a local variable.
The standard header <stdio.h> (or <cstdio>) shall not be included.
The predefined type specifiers char, short, int, long, float, double, signed and unsigned shall not be used in declarations other than typedefs.
Expressions with type enum shall only be used as operands to [ ] (subscript operator), =, ==, !=, unary &, <, <=, > and >=
If a member function can be made static then it shall be made static
The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations
A for loop shall have at most one loop-counter
A method definition shall not override a non-pure declaration
Type wchar_t shall not be used
The names of C++ standard library macros shall not be #undef'd
The upmost element of the body of the main function should be a universal try...catch block
The underlying bit representation of floating point values shall not be used.
Defined functions shall not be unused
Local variables shall be used
Bit operations shall only be applied to objects of underlying unsigned data types.
The width of the underlying type of an integer type cvalue (aka complex expression) shall not be increased by means of an explicit cast
Macros matching the given regular expression shall not be expanded.
Functional notation casts shall not be used
Objects of plain char type shall not be used as numeric values.
Non-standard characters shall not occur in header file names in #include directives.
Boolean operations whose results are invariant shall not be permitted.
A constructor shall call a constructor for each direct or virtual base explicitly
The sizeof operator shall not be used on expressions that contain side effects.
The filename of a header file shall match the given regular expression
Wide string literals (of type wchar_t*) shall not be used
Assignment operators shall take an lvalue reference as left hand side operand
Pointer arithmetic shall not be used.
Fields of non-POD classes shall be private
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by const reference
Objects of plain char type shall not be used as numeric values.
The declaration of objects shall contain no more than 2 levels of pointer indirection.
Each case clause shall be terminated by a break, continue, return or throw statement.
In functions with non-void return type, each exit path shall contain a final return statement.
If objects or functions are declared more than once their types shall be compatible.
Virtual calls to member functions of an object shall not be used within its constructor or destructor
The storage-class specifier static shall be used in all definitions and declarations of functions that have internal linkage.
Assignments shall only be carried out in single assignment statements.
A for loop shall have at least one loop-counter
There shall be no implicit floating-integral conversions
A non-const member function shall not return a non-const reference or pointer to a public class member
A loop-control-variable other than a loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or increment
An expression shall not modify and additionally access the same object unless a sequence point determines the order of access
A goto statement shall not jump to a label inside a try or catch block from outside of this block
C-style casts shall not be used
The lowercase character l shall not be used in a literal suffix.
The standard library functions "strcpy", "strcmp", "strcat", "strchr", "strspn", "strcspn", "strpbrk", "strrchr", "strstr", "strtok" and "strlen" shall not be used
There shall be no unreachable code
A typedef name shall be a unique identifier.
The filename of a non-header file shall match the given regular expression
A null statement shall only occur on a line by itself.
The entries of the member initializer list of a constructor (mem-initializer-list) shall resemble the effective initialization order
A default case shall be the last case of a switch statement
Non-explicit user-defined conversions shall not be declared
Trigraphs shall not be used.
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by non-const reference
An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used inside a catch handler
A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual
Non-standard escape sequences shall not be used.
User-defined literal suffixes not starting with an underscore are reserved for the standard libraray and thus shall not be used
A declaration shall not list multiple declarators
Expressions with type bool shall not be used as operands to non-boolean operators
Poitner arithmetic shall not be used with pointers to non-final classes
An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one external definition.
The # and ## preprocessor operators shall not be used.
A cvalue (aka complex expression) shall not be casted explicitly from integer to floating type
For array declarations, the array size shall be stated
The right-hand operands of && and || shall not contain side effects.
Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types
The defined operator shall not be generated by macro replacement.
The body of a loop shall be a compound statement.
The condition of an if-statement shall have type bool
A virtual method shall be flagged 'virtual', 'override' or 'final'
Each virtual function shall be declared with the virtual keyword
The underlying signedness of an integer expression shall not be implicitly changed
If bitwise operators ~ or << are applied to an operand of the type unsigned char or short, the result shall be casted immediately to the type of the operand.
A lambda expression shall not be inside another lambda expression
Explicit user-defined conversions shall not be declared
Named function parameters of virtual methods shall be used
Digraphs shall not be used
The unary operator & shall not be overloaded
Narrow and wide string literals shall not be concatenated
A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast
Functions shall not be called main except for the program entry point
Line continuation shall not be used in // comments.
Parameters of a function-like macro shall be enclosed in parentheses unless they are used as the operand of # or ##.
A cast shall not be performed from an integral type to a pointer to object type
Casts shall not be performed from pointer to void to an integer type
The width of the underlying type of a float type cvalue (aka complex expression) shall not be increased by means of an explicit cast
The standard header <errno.h> (or <cerrno>) shall not be included.
All macro identifiers in preprocessor directives shall be defined before use, except in #ifdef, #ifndef and after 'defined'.
An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer
If a member function can be made const then it shall be made const
Macro arguments shall not contain preprocessing directives
The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment.
The underlying signedness of a cvalue (aka complex expression) shall not be changed by means of an explicit cast
A switch label shall only be used in a compound statement forming the body of a switch statement.
asm statements shall not be used
A loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or statement
Both operands of the bitwise binary operators |, & and ^ shall have the same underlying type
#error directives shall not be used
The comma operator shall not be used.
A const member function shall not return a non-const reference or pointer to a public class member
There shall be no expression statements consisting of a constructor call only
Casts shall not be performed from pointer to void into function pointer
Enum declarations shall be scoped, i.e. declared using enum class/struct
The body of an if or else statement shall be a compound statement (or another if statement in case of an else).
All declarations of a function with exception-specification shall list the same type-ids
The standard library function "system" of the standard header <stdlib.h> shall not be used.
Warning issued by the clang frontend
A lambda shall not be an operand to typeid
Objects of external linkage shall have a declaration in a header file
The default argument for the parameter of a virtual overriding function shall match the one given for the overwritten function
The standard header <time.h> (or <ctime>) shall not be included.
A case or default label shall not reside inside a try or catch block unless the whole switch statement is inside of this block
NULL shall not be thrown explicitly
The type-qualifier 'volatile' shall not be used
Named function parameters of non-virtual functions shall be used.
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit
Warns if an exception handler will not be reached because of a preceeding handler
The width of the underlying type of an expression of arithmetic type shall not be decreased by an implicit conversion
Directives that do not comply with the constraints are dropped by the frontend.
The lowercase character f shall not be used in a literal suffix
goto statements shall not jump to a label declared earlier in the function.
No statements or declarations shall precede the first clause of a switch statement.
dynamic_cast shall not be used
The standard library functions "atof", "atoi" and "atol" shall not be used.
Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant
For tentative array definitions, the array size shall be stated explicitly
